intro: Pollinidium angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pollinidium, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its flowers are primarily pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinator populations. The plant is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
